matrxs.actions.door_actions¶

Functions

is_possible_door_open_close(grid_world, …)

Same as is_possible, but this function uses the action_kwargs to get a more accurate prediction.

Classes

CloseDoorAction([duration_in_ticks])

Action to open a Door

CloseDoorActionResult(result, succeeded)

OpenDoorAction([duration_in_ticks])

Action to open a Door

OpenDoorActionResult(result, succeeded)

class matrxs.actions.door_actions.OpenDoorAction(duration_in_ticks=1)¶

Action to open a Door

__init__(duration_in_ticks=1)¶
Parameters

  • name – The name of the action.

  • duration_in_ticks – The duration of the action in ticks. By default this is 1.

mutate(grid_world, agent_id, **kwargs)¶

Performs the actual action in the world. Opens the door, by changing the colour and setting the open_door property

Parameters

  • grid_world – A pointer to the actual world object.

  • agent_id – The id known in the grid world as an agent that peforms this action.

  • kwargs – Requires the door_range (int indicating cells range) and object_id arguments.

Returns

An action result depicting the action’s success or failure and reason/description of that result.

is_possible(grid_world, agent_id, **kwargs)¶

Checks whether the action is possible in the world when performed by the given agent.

Parameters

  • grid_world – A pointer to the actual world object.

  • agent_id – The id known in the grid world as an agent that peforms this action.

Returns

Returns two things; a boolean signalling whether the action is possible or not, and a string telling

you why the action was not possible.

class matrxs.actions.door_actions.CloseDoorAction(duration_in_ticks=1)¶

Action to open a Door

__init__(duration_in_ticks=1)¶
Parameters

  • name – The name of the action.

  • duration_in_ticks – The duration of the action in ticks. By default this is 1.

mutate(grid_world, agent_id, **kwargs)¶

Performs the actual action in the world. Opens the door, by changing the colour and setting the open_door property

Parameters

  • grid_world – A pointer to the actual world object.

  • agent_id – The id known in the grid world as an agent that peforms this action.

  • kwargs – Requires the door_range (int indicating cells range) and object_id arguments.

Returns

An action result depicting the action’s success or failure and reason/description of that result.

is_possible(grid_world, agent_id, **kwargs)¶

Checks whether the action is possible in the world when performed by the given agent.

Parameters

  • grid_world – A pointer to the actual world object.

  • agent_id – The id known in the grid world as an agent that peforms this action.

Returns

Returns two things; a boolean signalling whether the action is possible or not, and a string telling

you why the action was not possible.

class matrxs.actions.door_actions.CloseDoorActionResult(result, succeeded)¶
RESULT_SUCCESS = 'Door was succesfully closed.'¶
NO_DOORS_IN_RANGE = 'No door found in range'¶
NOT_IN_RANGE = 'Specified door is not within range.'¶
NOT_A_DOOR = "CloseDoor action could not be performed, as object isn't a door"¶
RESULT_UNKNOWN_OBJECT_TYPE = 'obj_id is no Agent and no Object, unknown what to do'¶
DOOR_ALREADY_CLOSED = "Can't close door, door is already closed."¶
DOOR_BLOCKED = "Can't close door, object or agent is blocking the door opening."¶
NO_OBJECT_SPECIFIED = 'No object_id of a door specified to close.'¶
__init__(result, succeeded)¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

class matrxs.actions.door_actions.OpenDoorActionResult(result, succeeded)¶
RESULT_SUCCESS = 'Door was successfully opened.'¶
NO_DOORS_IN_RANGE = 'No door found in range'¶
NOT_IN_RANGE = 'Specified door is not within range.'¶
NOT_A_DOOR = "OpenDoor action could not be performed, as object isn't a door"¶
RESULT_UNKNOWN_OBJECT_TYPE = 'obj_id is no Agent and no Object, unknown what to do'¶
DOOR_ALREADY_OPEN = "Can't open door, door is already open"¶
DOOR_BLOCKED = "Can't close door, object or agent is blocking the door opening."¶
NO_OBJECT_SPECIFIED = 'No object_id of a door specified to open.'¶
__init__(result, succeeded)¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

matrxs.actions.door_actions.is_possible_door_open_close(grid_world, agent_id, action_result, object_id=None, door_range=<Mock id='84734064'>)¶

Same as is_possible, but this function uses the action_kwargs to get a more accurate prediction. Can be used both for checking if the door is already open or closed
